channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023070065
item.description:
Report E-2023070065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 21, 2023, at 1400 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in St. Petersburg, Florida regarding the release of approximately (55) gallons of COR61-AA-332 DCPD Laminating Resin (Resin Solution (contains Styrene Monomer), UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release. Upon arrival, contractors were unable to locate any damaged cargo. No waste was generated from this event.

item.title: Report X-2023061600
item.description:
Report X-2023061600

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Steel Drum was placed in plastic bag and brought to cage from unload for inspection. The bracket the handle attaches to was damaged causing red liquid to leak out. Drum and contents were placed in a hazmat bag and salvage drum. DescribePack: Handle bracket close to the top of drum was broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum and contents placed in a hazmat bag and salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061537
item.description:
Report X-2023061537

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being RTS'd because it was missing the hazmat paperwork. When discovered wet, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Master Care Pro-Blue heavy duty coil cleaner leaked from loose caps. Only molded foam on top of the bottles was used as inner packing materials. Caps were not secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023061499
item.description:
Report X-2023061499

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded to a van when it was discovered wet. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both plastic bottles of Immunocal formic acid bone decalcifier leaked from loose caps. Both bottles have a seal but the caps were not secured. Only paper in between both bottles was used as inner packing materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023061250
item.description:
Report X-2023061250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: FORT MYERS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded out of door 10 in the unload. Package handler notice package was a hazmat and was also wet. They shut of the belt and requested for a manager to come over and remove the damaged hazmat package so they could safely continue to work. DescribePack: a loose cap caused an internal leak on this hazmat package. A piece of tape could help hold caps in place and help prevent future leaking packages DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When package was found it was placed directly into a hazmat tote to help prevent more spilling.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking. It was immediately placed in a Hazmat container to minimize the spillage. DescribePack: The package was wet and leaking. The side of the fiberboard box was soaked and ripped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the package was noticed to be leaking, it was immediately placed in a Hazmat container so that the spill would be limited.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was already inside the HazMat Cage during morning audit. Someone had already scanned it a 39 and put it inside the Cage. I put it in a red tote and HazMat bag. DescribePack: The top and side of box was wet. One cap was loose within the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I put it in a red tote and HazMat bag. Someone before myself had already moved it to the HazMat Cage on a pallet.

item.title: Report E-2023060653
item.description:
Report E-2023060653

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 05:30 pm (eastern) on 5/24/2023, Eagle Transport called CDG for assistance in locating a contractor capable of performing cleanup of a tanker truck that experienced a crude oil leak at Devil’s Garden Oil Truck Loading Facility. The leak occurred at the front of the tank trailer where it meets the 5th wheel trailer hitch (photos attached), the cause of the leak is unknown at this time. The crew successfully placed booms in front of the loading bay’s drain basin and installed an inflatable drain plug in the basin upon the facility’s request to not let the wastewater flow into the drain. The truck was then steam pressure-washed to remove residual crude oil prior to departure.

item.title: Report E-2023060644
item.description:
Report E-2023060644

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was stopped delivering fuel at Braman Car Care Center when a City of Miami police officer exited the car wash and struck our drop fitting. This resulted in damage to the drop fitting and causing a spill of approximately 10 gallons of premium gas. Police reported to the scene due to the accident, not due to the spill.
